segments.text: We were very much younger then.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And very much sillier.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: However I believe the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  You knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents?  It was only a trivial, little brooch.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It was bristling with diamonds.  In the worst possible taste, too.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It was not.  I still have it, and I wear it often.  It is very pretty.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I did not.  You worked that whole thing up in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well, you let him kiss you, huh?  You said you did.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh dear.  I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So am I.  I'm bored stiff. [GARBAGE]  Do you want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.  Thank you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have a little, I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know why you'd want any, you've already had three glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow, they are very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I just think it's silly to go on and on and on about such a thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can hardly call three glasses of liquor a whole evening long, going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh.  Don't be so grand.  Just because you don't happen to want one at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really, Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: you going out somewhere, dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No.  I am just making myself fascinating for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  It's a woman's duty to allure the man.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well as a matter of fact, yes, that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh really.  It's a pity you didn't have any brandy, it would have made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's funny it hasn't worked such wonders for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Snap, snap, snap.  You know you are like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nonsense.  They have a bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap. They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting. I don't care.  Do you understand?  I don't care if they bark and they roll about like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes I did, quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more than, too. Yes.  I suppose you guys had a riotous time, huh?  All out, no restraint at all.  Well, you never really had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your own business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're quite insufferable, I expect it's because you are drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I am not in the least bit drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think I mentioned once before that I've had three minute liquor glasses the whole evening long.  A child of two cannot get drunk on that.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child of two can get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That's very interesting Amanda. How about a child of four?  Or a child of six?  Or a child of nine? We can get a good little conversation going on about this, you know, intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Not very funny, darling.  Why don't you have some more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: [LAUGHTER] That's a very good idea.  I think I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Look, you better turn that off. I don't want to wake up the people upstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: There are no people upstairs; it's a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well then you'll wake up the people downstairs.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They are away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: This is no time of year for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I will do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Fine if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Will you turn that off, it's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You are far too temperamental, try to control yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I won't.  Let go, let go of me. Listen, listen?  I'm sick and tired of listening to you, you sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Amanda, listen, listen.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  That's very amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh shut up.  Let go.  I hate you, I hate you.  Do you hear?  You are a conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You are a vile, ill-tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I never want to see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end.  Do you hear me?  Finally and forever.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going like this.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh.  Yes I am.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes I am.   Stop it. Stop it.  Let go of me. Oh.  You're a cruel fiend.  I loathe and I hate you. Marry you again?  Never, never, never. I hope you die in torment, you brute beast cad.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Shut up. Shut up. God, I wouldn't marry you again if you came crawling back to me on a bended knee.  You are a vile, ill-tempered, mean little wench and I never want to see you again as long as I live.
segments.speaker: M
